acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from ErC50=0.226mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of > 5,000mg/kg (RTECS (2006) and IUCLID (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (RTECS (2006) and IUCLID (2000)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on a judgment made by experts in the absence of existing classification, though IUCLID (2000) presents some toxicity data.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.23(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 134.8degC, Merck (13th, 2001)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (details are not available on the protocols of in vivo studies).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on offspring development (fetal death and muscle skeletal anomalies), described in IUCLID (2000) and RTECS (2006) (though no data are available regarding parental toxicity).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 134.8degC (Merck (13th, 2001)), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: No evidence of irritation was observed in a rabbit eye irritation test (IUCLID (2000)). Although the substance could be "Not classified" based solely on the results of the above study, "Classification not possible" should be appropriate since the study is assigned a priority rating of 2 and no other data are available to provide additional or supporting evidence.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: No evidence of irritation was observed in a rabbit skin irritation test (though the results are not those of 4 hour application) (IUCLID (2000)). Although the substance could be "Not classified" based solely on the results of the above study, "Classification not possible" should be appropriate since the study is assigned a priority rating of 2 and no other data are available to provide additional or supporting evidence.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "normocytic anemia" (RTECS (1996)), "kidney effects including renal failure and renal tubular necrosis" (RTECS (1996)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data.
